title: A2 - Modal Verbs Quiz
description: Test your understanding of modal verbs in German

questions.feedback: Correct! 'kann' is the correct conjugation of 'können' for the first person singular (ich).
Correct! 'Kannst' is the correct conjugation of 'können' for the second person singular (du).
Correct! 'muss' is the correct conjugation of 'müssen' for the third person singular (er).
Correct! 'müssen' is the correct conjugation of 'müssen' for the first person plural (wir).
Correct! 'Darf' is the correct conjugation of 'dürfen' for the first person singular (ich) in a question.
Correct! 'dürft' is the correct conjugation of 'dürfen' for the second person plural (ihr).
Correct! 'möchte' is used to express a polite request or wish.
Correct! 'können' is used to express ability.

questions.text: Which modal verb expresses necessity or obligation?
questions.feedback: Correct! 'müssen' is used to express necessity or obligation.
Correct! 'dürfen' is used to express permission.
Correct! 'sollst' is the correct conjugation of 'sollen' for the second person singular (du).

questions.text: Wir _______ nächstes Jahr nach Deutschland reisen.
questions.feedback: Correct! 'wollen' is the correct conjugation of 'wollen' for the first person plural (wir).
Correct! In sentences with modal verbs, the modal verb takes the second position, and the main verb in its infinitive form goes to the end of the clause.
Correct! 'mag' is the correct conjugation of 'mögen' for the third person singular (sie).

questions.text: Which modal verb is used in the sentence: 'Ich will ein neues Auto kaufen'?
questions.feedback: Correct! 'wollen' (to want to) is used in this sentence.
